topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Creating Multiple VSA Clusters

body.p:
You can create multiple VSA clusters of same or different type by specifying the configuration in the cloud model. The term add and update in the document means editing the respective YAML files to add or update the configurations/values.
Prerequisites
You must have minimum three nodes per VSA cluster.

section.title: Cloud Configuration Changes to Create More Than One Cluster
section.p: You must edit the YAML files to create more than one cluster. In this cloud configuration, you are modifying the YAML files for a same set of disk.

ol.li:
Add new nodes in servers.yml file with unique name and node_id for each cluster.
Example: The following servers.yml file list six nodes for two clusters.- id: vsa1 ip-addr: 192.168.61.15 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK1 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.232 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:8C:B0
- id: vsa2 ip-addr: 192.168.61.16 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK2 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.233 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:0E:30
- id: vsa3 ip-addr: 192.168.61.17 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.234 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:2D:00
- id: vsa4 ip-addr: 192.168.62.15 role: VSA-ROLE-1 server-group: RACK1 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.193.232 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:8C:B0
- id: vsa5 ip-addr: 192.168.63.16 role: VSA-ROLE-1 server-group: RACK2 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.194.233 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:0E:30
- id: vsa6 ip-addr: 192.168.64.17 role: VSA-ROLE-1 server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.195.234 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:2D:00

Add new resource in control_plane.yml file with name, resource-prefix, and server-role.
Example: The following control_plane.yml file contains the information of the newly added resource nodes. --- product: version: 2
resources: - name: vsa resource-prefix: vsa server-role: ROLE-VSA allocation-policy: strict min-count: 0 service-components: - ntp-client - vsa
- name: vsa1 resource-prefix: vsa1 server-role: ROLE-VSA-1 allocation-policy: strict min-count: 0 service-components: - ntp-client - vsa
The control plane have the following fields:
name This is a name assigned for the cluster. In the above example vsacluster1 and vsacluster2.
resource-prefix It is the prefix of that resource cluster.
server-role Role assigned to that cluster.

Update server_roles.yml with new VSA nodes.
Example: In the following server_roles.yml file new VSA nodes are added/updated. --- product: version: 2
server-roles:
- name: ROLE-VSA interface-model: INTERFACE_SET_VSA disk-model: DISK_SET_VSA
- name: ROLE-VSA-1 interface-model: INTERFACE_SET_VSA disk-model: DISK_SET_VSA
The server roles have the following fields:
name This is a name assigned for the cluster. In the above example vsacluster1 and vsacluster2.
disk-model The type of disk available for the clusters. It can be same set of disk or different set of disks. In the above example only one set of disk model is shown ,i.e., DISK_SET_VSA.

section.title: Cloud Configuration Changes to Create Two Cluster with Different Set of Disks
section.p: You must edit the YAML files to create more than one cluster. In this cloud configuration, you are adding or updating the YAML files for a different set of disks, i.e., one with adoptive optimization (AO) enabled and another without adoptive optimization.

ol.li: Add new nodes in severs.yml with unique name .
Add new resource node under resources in control_plane.yml with a unique name, resource-prefix, and server-role.

Modify the disk_set for AO and without AO. Ensure that you use different files and different disk_set. In the example inout model you will find only disks_vsa.yml file, which contains the information for both AO and without AO. You must create a separate YAML file and enter the configuration information of AO in that file. for creating non ao disk eg-link

Update server_roles.yml with new VSA nodes and appropriate disk_set used for that node.
Example: In the following servers_roles.yml file you can see both AO and without AO assigned for the node.--- product: version: 2
server-roles:
- name: ROLE-CONTROLLER interface-model: INTERFACE_SET_CONTROLLER disk-model: DISK_SET_CONTROLLER
- name: ROLE-COMPUTE interface-model: INTERFACE_SET_COMPUTE disk-model: DISK_SET_COMPUTE
- name: ROLE-VSA interface-model: INTERFACE_SET_VSA disk-model: DISK_SET_VSA
- name: ROLE-VSA-1 interface-model: INTERFACE_SET_VSA disk-model: DISK_SET_VSA_AOIf you have configured your cloud to have more than one cluster or n-clusters then remember to note down all the cluster IPs.
